mission.title: Our Mission
content: At Capsule Note, we believe in the power of reflection and the importance of connecting with your future self. In a world of instant communication, we're building something different—a bridge between your present thoughts and your future moments.

Our mission is to help people preserve their thoughts, dreams, goals, and memories for delivery at the perfect moment in the future. Whether it's a letter of encouragement before a big event, reflections on a milestone, or simply words you want your future self to remember.
mission.highlight: Every letter you write today becomes a gift to your future self—a snapshot of who you were, delivered exactly when you need it most.

story.title: Our Story
content: Capsule Note was born from a simple idea: what if you could send a letter to yourself in the future? Not just a reminder or a calendar notification, but a real, thoughtful message that captures who you are today.

We started building Capsule Note after realizing how meaningful it can be to receive words from your past self. A letter written before starting a new job, arriving on your one-year anniversary. Birthday wishes you wrote to yourself a decade ago. Encouragement you penned during a difficult time, delivered when you're thriving.

Today, we're dedicated to making time capsule letters secure, reliable, and delightful. Every feature we build is designed to honor the trust you place in us to keep your words safe until their moment arrives.

introduction.title: Introduction
content: This Privacy Policy explains how Capsule Note ("we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our time capsule letter service.

By using Capsule Note, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.

overview.title: Security Overview
content: At Capsule Note, we understand that you're entrusting us with your most personal thoughts and memories. We take this responsibility seriously and have built our platform with security as a core principle.

Our security architecture is designed around the concept of "zero knowledge"—meaning we cannot access your letter content, even if we wanted to. Your letters are encrypted on our servers, and only you hold the keys to decrypt them.

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.intro: All letter content is encrypted using industry-standard encryption algorithms:

highlight.title: Zero-Knowledge Architecture
highlight.description: We cannot read your letters. Your content is encrypted before storage using keys derived from your account, making it mathematically impossible for us to access your letter content.

encryption.zeroKnowledge: Each letter is encrypted with a unique nonce, ensuring that even identical content produces different ciphertext. Key rotation is supported to allow periodic key updates without re-encrypting all existing content.

infrastructure.title: Infrastructure Security
infrastructure.intro: Our infrastructure is built on enterprise-grade cloud platforms with multiple layers of security:
features: SOC 2 Type II compliant cloud infrastructure
Database encryption at rest and in transit
Automated daily backups with point-in-time recovery
DDoS protection and Web Application Firewall (WAF)

access.title: Access Control
access.intro: We implement strict access controls to protect your data:
features: Multi-factor authentication for all administrative access
Role-based access control (RBAC) with least-privilege principle
Comprehensive audit logging of all data access
Secure development practices and code review
Employee security training and background checks

compliance.title: Compliance
compliance.intro: We maintain compliance with industry standards and regulations:

certifications.name: GDPR
certifications.description: Compliant with EU data protection requirements

reporting.title: Security Reporting
reporting.intro: We take all security reports seriously and appreciate the security research community's efforts to help keep Capsule Note safe.

contact.title: Report a Vulnerability
contact.description: If you believe you've found a security vulnerability in Capsule Note, please report it responsibly:

reporting.process: We will acknowledge receipt of your report within 48 hours and provide regular updates on our investigation. We do not pursue legal action against security researchers who follow responsible disclosure practices.
